ar.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

eo.definitions: li, ŝi, ri, ĝi, ili
eo.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
eo.commentary: Vorto farita en enketo en 2002. Ĝi anstataŭigis la vorton "iki", kiun oni konsideris tro simila al "ike". Aliaj ebloj en la enketo inkluzivis "ipi", kaj ankaŭ "i" en antaŭa enketo.

eng.definitions: he, she, it, they
eng.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
eng.commentary: This word was coined in a poll in 2002. It replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar-sounding to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi" and "i".

yi.definitions: he, she, it, they
yi.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
yi.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

tr.definitions: o, onlar
tr.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
tr.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

es.definitions: él, ella, ello, elle, lo, la, le, ellos, ellas
es.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
es.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

uk.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
uk.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

lt.definitions: he, she, it, they
lt.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
lt.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

nl.definitions: hij, zij, het, hen, die, zij
nl.sp_etymology: misschien een hand dat naar de zijkant wijst. zie mi en ona
nl.commentary: Voorgesteld in een peiling uit 2002. Verving "iki", waarvan men vond dat het te hard op "ike" leek. Andere opties in de peiling waren "ipi" net als "i" in een eerdere peiling.

pl.sp_etymology: perhaps a hand pointing sideways. compare mi and sina
pl.commentary: Coined in a poll in 2002. Replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi", as well as "i" in a previous poll.

eng.sp_etymology: two heart symbols (♡), perhaps to distinguish from pilin
eng.commentary: In english, "love" can be used to mean "like a lot", but in toki pona, "olin" doesn't work that way. It indicates an emotional connection or bond, not preference

nb.definitions: fot, bein, ganglem; bunn, nedre del
nb.sp_etymology: pictogram of a foot with an ankle
nb.commentary: In a 2002 poll, "jalan" was proposed to replace "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes. In pu, "noka" has the meaning of "place that is down". In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has that meaning instead. noka had speculative and/or joking use for numbers, comparable to luka: ten, twenty, negative five.

pt.sp_etymology: pictogram of a foot with an ankle
pt.commentary: No pu, "noka" tem o significado de "lugar em baixo". Em uso comum (antes e depois do pu), "anpa" tinha este significado. noka tem uso experimental e/ou humorístico como um numeral, comparável como luka: dez, vinte, cinco negativo.

he.definitions: רגל, כף רגל, איבר תנועה; תחתית, חלק תחתון
he.sp_etymology: אייקון של כף רגל עם קרסול
he.commentary: In a 2002 poll, "jalan" was proposed to replace "noka". However, it failed to get enough votes. In pu, "noka" has the meaning of "place that is down". In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has that meaning instead. noka had speculative and/or joking use for numbers, comparable to luka: ten, twenty, negative five.

nl.sp_etymology: pictogram van een voet en enkel
nl.commentary: In een peiling uit 2002 werd "jalan" voorgesteld om "noka" te vervangen. Het kreeg echter niet genoeg stemmen. In pu betekent "noka" 'laagliggende plaats'. Bij algemeen gebruik (zowel voor als na pu), neemt "anpa" die betekenis aan. noka had een speculatief/grappend gebruik als een getal, vergelijkbaar met luka: 10, 20, -5.

nb.definitions: (alternativ form av ale)
nb.sp_etymology: infinity symbol (∞)
nb.commentary: "ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" has been more common since at least the release of pu. Generally not considered a word in its own right.

pu_verbatim.de: PARTIKEL (zwischen jedem Subjekt und dem zugehörigen Verb, außer bei einzelnem mi oder einzelnem sina; auch um ein neues Verb für dasselbe Subjekt einzuleiten)
pu_verbatim.en: PARTICLE (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)
pu_verbatim.eo: PARTIKULO (inter subjekto krom sola mi aŭ sola sina kaj ties verbo; ankaŭ por enkonduki novan verbon de la sama subjekto)
pu_verbatim.fr: PARTICULE (entre le sujet et son verbe, à l'exception de mi ou sina tout seul ; sert aussi à introduire un nouveau verbe pour le même sujet)

nb.definitions: (brukes mellom subjekt som ikke er bare "mi" eller bare "sina" og verb; introduserer nytt verb for samme subjekt)

ja.definitions: (主語が mi か sina のみである場合を除き、主語と述語の間におく; 同じ主語に対して別の述語を並立する際にも用いる)

ro.definitions: (între orice subiec cu excepțlie mi singiru și sina singur și verburile lor; se poate folosi și pentru a întroduce un verb nou pentru același subiect)

fi.definitions: (subjektin (paitsi mi, sina) ja verbin välillä; esittelee uuden verbin samalle subjektille)

zh_hant.definitions: （置於任何主語及其動詞之間，主語僅是 mi 或僅是 sina 的情況除外；也用於在同一個主語上引入另一個動詞）

sl.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

id.definitions: (di antara semua subjek kalimat kecuali mi saja atau sina saja dan verba; juga untuk memasukkan verba baru dengan subjek kalimat yang sama)

ith_n.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

nn.definitions: (brukast mellom subjekt som ikkje er berre "mi" eller berre "sina" og verb; introduserer nytt verb for same subjekt)

en.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

ru.definitions: (между любым подлежащим, кроме единственного mi или единственного sina, и его сказуемым; также для ввода нового сказуемого для того же подлежащего)

io.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

de.definitions: (zwischen einem beliebigen Subjekt außer "mi" oder "sina" und seinem Verb; auch zur Einführung eines neuen Verbs für dasselbe Subjekt)

hi.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

pa.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

tkl.definitions: (ki te vā o te mea, e fai, (kae hē fakaaogā mō “mi” tautahi pe mō “sina” tautahi) ma te veape; ke fakaaliali veape fōu foki i te fuaikupu, kua tū ai tētahi veape)

it.definitions: (tra qualsiasi soggetto tranne mi da solo o sina da solo e il suo verbo; anche per introdurre un nuovo verbo per lo stesso soggetto)

hr.definitions: (između subjekta (osim "mi" i "sina") i predikata; dodavanje drugog predikata istom subjektu)

mi.definitions: (ki waenga i te tumu (engari, ehara mō te “mi” anake, mō te “sina” anake rānei) me te tūmahi; whaihoki, e whakamahia ana mō te tūmahi hou i te rerenga kōrero, e tū kē ai tētahi tūmahi)

tl_l.definitions: (sa pagitan ng simuno at pandiwa, maliban kung ang simuno ay "mi" o "sina" lang; pananda bago ang karagdagang pandiwa)

isv_c.definitions: (меджу кторым-либо субјектом, кромє јединого ми або јединого сина, и јего предикатом; такоже дља вводжења нового предиката томуже субјекту)

el.definitions: (Ανάμεσα σε οποιοδήποτε θέμα εκτός από το mi σκέτο ή το sina σκέτο και το ρήμα του. επίσης να εισάγει ένα νέο ρήμα για το ίδιο θέμα)

ceb_l.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

cy.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

ko.definitions: ("mi"와 "sina"를 제외한 모든 주어와 동사 사이; 같은 주어에 대해 새 동사를 넣을 때도 사용 가능)

la.definitions: (ante praedicātum [verbum agentem], nisī subjectum praecēdens est "mi" aut "sina")

fr.definitions: (entre le sujet et son verbe, à l'exception de mi ou sina tout seul; sert aussi à introduire un nouveau verbe pour le même sujet)

ur.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

cs.definitions: (mezi podmětem [kromě samotného mi či samotného sina] a přísudkem; též uvádí několikanásobný přísudek)

tok.definitions: nimi li li tu e nimi ijo e nimi pali lon toki

da.definitions: (mellem et hvilket som helst subjekt undtagen "mi" eller "sina" alene og dets verbum; også for at introducere et nyt verbum for det samme subjekt)

zh_hans.definitions: （置于任何主语及其动词之间，主语仅是 mi 或仅是 sina 的情况除外；也用于在同一个主语上引入另一个动词）

isv_l.definitions: (medžu ktorym-libo subjektom, kromě jedinogo mi abo jedinogo sina, i jego predikatom; takože dlja vvodženja novogo predikata tomuže subjektu)

haw.definitions: (i waena o ke kumuʻōlelo (koe “mi” wale, ā i ʻole “sina” wale) me ka haʻina; e hoʻopuka haʻina hou hoʻi i ka māmalaʻōlelo, e kū ʻē ai kekahi haʻina)

sv.definitions: (mellan ett subjekt (förutom endast mi eller endast sina) och dess verb; introducerar ett nytt verb för samma subjekt)

pt.definitions: (entre qualquer sujeito exceto só mi ou só sina e o seu verbo; também para introduzir um novo verbo ao mesmo sujeito)

he.definitions: (בין כל נושא חוץ מmi או sina לבדם והפועל שלו; כדי להציג פועל חדש לאותו נושא)

ar.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

eo.definitions: (inter ajna subjekto krom nura “mi” aŭ nura “sina” kaj ties verbo; ankaŭ por enkonduki novan verbon de la sama subjekto)

eng.definitions: (particle) [mark the start of an indicative verb (statement)]

yi.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

tr.definitions: ("mi" ve "sina" istisnaları haricinde her özne ve sonrasında gelen fiil arasına gelir; ayrıca aynı özne için farklı bir fiil uygularken fiilin başında gelir)

es.definitions: (entre cualquier sujeto, excepto mi o sina, y su verbo; también introduce un verbo nuevo para el mismo sujeto)

uk.definitions: (між будь-яким підметом який відрізняється від mi чи sina наодинці і присудком; також між однорідними присудками)

lt.definitions: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)

nl.definitions: (geeft het gezegde aan; komt niet voor als het onderwerp alleen ‘mi’ of alleen ‘sina’ is; geeft nieuwe gezegdes aan die bij hetzelfde onderwerp horen)

pl.definitions: (pomiędzy podmiotem innym od samego mi czy samego sina a jego orzeczeniem; także wprowadza nowe orzeczenie dla tego samego podmiotu)

nb.definitions: anarki, opprør, oppstand
nb.sp_etymology: circle-A, an anarchy symbol
nb.commentary: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.

etymology.definition: 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

yi.sp_etymology: circle-A, an anarchy symbol
yi.commentary: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.

etymology.definition: 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

nl.sp_etymology: cirkel + A, symbool voor anarchie
nl.commentary: Het woord komt van een verhaal "jan pi Kamalawala". Een naam van de personages wordt er beschreven als "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", en de ingekorte versie werd dan "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is verantwoordelijk voor het feit dat het een afzonderlijk woord is geworden in plaats van een naam.

nb.definitions: (brukes mellom flere subjekt)
nb.sp_etymology: from plus sign (+); compare blissymbol “and”.
nb.commentary: There are various analyses of the syntactic role of "en". Originally intended to be used as "and", it was changed (via poll in 2002) to just be used with "head nouns". One of the more recent analyses (including 2021's April Fools) treats "en" as a subject marker.

nl.sp_etymology: van het plusteken (+); zie blissymbool "en".
nl.commentary: Er zijn verschillende analyses gemaakt over de syntactische rol van "en". Origineel bedoeld hetzelfde te zijn als de Nederlandse "en", werd het in 2002 na een peiling gewijzigd om enkel bij "hoofdnamen" te passen. Een van de recentere analyses (waaronder de eenaprilgrap van 2021) wordt het als een onderwerpsaanduider gebruikt.

nb.definitions: menneske, person, noen
nb.sp_etymology: head radical; pictogram of a person showing the shoulders

yi.commentary: There are two sides to the concept, "sentient entity" and "homo sapiens", which matters for whether to use the word in edge cases (i.e. aliens, humans turned into werewolves, etc). Which sense is more central to the word remains controversial.

sutopatikuna.author_verbatim: Dear Sonja, That's a great idea, but if you do so, you need also to add a special word forthe Platypus (Ornithorhynchus anatinus). I would suggest the word "sutopatikuna"from the croatian word Èudnovati kljuna¹. Bonega ideo, sed se vi farus tion, vi devus ankaux aldoni apartan vorton porla Ornitorinko (Ornithorhynchus anatinus). Mi proponus la vorton "sutopatikuna"prenita de la kroatan vorton Èudnovati kljuna¹.:P

nb.definitions: alle; tallrik, drøssevis, tusenvis, rikelig, overflod; alt, liv, univers | ALT ett hundre
nb.sp_etymology: infinity symbol (∞)
nb.commentary:
"ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" remains more common.
The majority of speakers report not understanding the "abundant, bountiful, plentiful" meaning, at least out of context.
"20, 120" were non-pu meanings previously in use in the community alongside 100; they are virtually unheard of nowadays.

"20, 120" were non-pu meanings previously in use in the community alongside 100; they are virtually unheard of nowadays.

nb.definitions: three
nb.commentary:
More popular than the synonymous (and older) tuli.
san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the dictionary.

san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the dictionary.

nl.commentary:
Populairder dan het synoniem "tuli" (dat ouder is).
san was ook deel van de 10 cijferwoorden van jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 t/m 9).
Al deze nieuwe woorden (buiten san), zijn niet noemenswaardig genoeg om in het woordenboek opgenomen te worden.

tr.definitions: George Lucas gibi davranmak ve "eski yaratıcı çalışmalarımı revize edeyim" derken daha da batırmak
tr.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

es.definitions: hacer como George Lucas y editar tus obras creativas anteriores pero en realidad solo empeorarlas
es.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

uk.definitions: поводитися як Джордж Лукас, передивлятися своє старе мистецтво і цим руйнувати його
uk.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

lt.definitions: to behave like George Lucas and revise your old creative works and actually make them worse
lt.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

nl.definitions: je gedragen zoals George Lucas: Je oude werken herzien en ze daarmee slechter maken
nl.commentary: Eerst gebruikt als eenn willekeurige toetsencombinatie. Men denkt dat jan Sonja "y" per ongeluk heeft gebruikt, maar het dan deel van de grap heeft laten worden, door "niemand weet hoe je "y" moet uitspreken" toe te voegen.

pl.definitions: zachowywać się jak George Lucas i poprawiać swoje stare prace twórcze, na wskutek czego je pogarszać
pl.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".

nb.definitions: (synonymt med lukin) | ALT auge, okulær, optisk (jamfør lukin)
nb.sp_etymology: eye from a side
nb.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.

ja.definitions: {lukin を参照} | ALT 目、視覚の
ja.sp_etymology: eye from a side
ja.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.

ro.definitions: {see lukin} | ALT eye, ocular, visual {cf. lukin}
ro.sp_etymology: eye from a side
ro.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.

sipi.author_verbatim: I thought of another word which would mean the "ego", "self", "own",because Toki Pona doesn't have reflexive voice and pronoun like inthe sentences "he's watching himself (and not somebody else)" or "Hetake his own(not her) hand". I called it "sipi" (as it is "sibi" inLatin). Then it would be "ona li lukin e sipi (pi ona)" (he watcheshis ego) and "ona li jo e luka sipi (pi ona)" (he takes his ego'shand). It would also be used to compound words like "egoism"(nasin/pilin sipi) and so on...What do you think?
creator: spad0103

wasoweli.author_verbatim: In my Caves of Qud mod, I added toki-pona-speaking bird-beasts who call themselves "wasoweli"; I figured as 'native speakers' they're entitled to a portmanteau noun for themselves, and that's the only intentional artistic liberty I took with the language.
creator: akesi kon Nalasuni
jan Atenaja

nb.definitions: animal with qualities of both waso & soweli
nb.commentary: First used as the name for a species in a mod for Caves of Qud created by akesi kon Nalasuni. Later appeared in ku as exclusively part of a translation for "penguin".

ja.definitions: waso と soweli 双方の特徴をもつ動物 (ペンギンなど)

nb.definitions: mengden av alle mulige menneskelige konsepter subtrahert av mengden av konsepter som allerede er omfattet av etablerte toki pona-ord vektlagt etter sin relative bruk
nb.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

ja.definitions: 相対的使用率によって重みづけした既存のトキポナ単語で表現できる概念全体から漏れた、人間のもつあらゆる概念の集合
ja.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

ro.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
ro.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

da.definitions: mængden af alle mulige menneskelige begreber fratrukket mængden af begreber, der allerede er dækket af etablerede toki pona-ord, vægtet efter deres relative brug
da.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

zh_hans.definitions: 所有人类可以表达的概念，去除已确立道本语单词按相对使用频率加重的可以表达的概念
zh_hans.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

isv_l.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
isv_l.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

haw.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
haw.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

sv.definitions: mängden av alla möjliga männskliga objekt subtraherat från mängden koncept som etablerade ord i Toki Pona redan täcker, vägt efter deras relativa användning
sv.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

pt.definitions: o conjunto de todos os conceitos humanos possíveis subtraídos do conjunto de conceitos já cobertos por palavras existentes em toki pona ponderadas pelo seu uso relativo
pt.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

he.definitions: הקבוצה של כל רעיון אנושי אפשרי פחות הקבוצה של רעיונות שמכוסים של ידי מילות טוקי פונה מבוססות, משוקללות לפי השימוש היחסי שלהן
he.commentary: הוטבעה בתור בדיחה כ"nimisin האחרונה" - כל מילה חדשה תוכל להיכלל באופן סמנטי בתוך alente, כדי שיהיה אפשר להפריך אותה בתור "alente אבל יותר ספיציפית".

ar.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
ar.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

eo.definitions: ĉiuj homaj konceptoj, subrahita de ĉiuj konceptoj ke oni povas priskribi per Tokiponaj vortoj, ordigita per relativa uzado
eo.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

eng.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
eng.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

yi.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
yi.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

tr.definitions: toki pona kelimelerinin göreceli kullanımlarına göre ağırlıklandırılmasının kapsadığı konseptler kümesi eksi bütün olası insan konseptleri kümesi
tr.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

es.definitions: el grupo conformado por la suma de todos los conceptos imaginables, excepto los cuales ya están conceptualizados en la lista establecida de palabras en Toki Pona ordenadas según su frecuencia relativa de uso
es.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

uk.definitions: набір усіх можливих концепцій, що не покриває релативне використання існуючого списка широковикористованих токі пона слів
uk.commentary: Створене як жарт як «фінальний неологізм» — будь-яке інше слово буде семантично включене в alente, тож воно може бути заперечене через «це ж alente але трохи точніше».

lt.definitions: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage
lt.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

nl.definitions: De set van elk mogelijk menselijk consept, afgetrokken van de set van consepten die al bedekt worden door bestaande toki pona woorden in verhouding van hun relatief gebruik
nl.commentary: Men noemde het "de laatste nimisin" - elk volgend woord zou semantisch gezien een deel van "alente" uitmaken, dus zouden de volgende woorden overbodig zijn, want ze zijn gewoon "alente, maar dan nog specifieker".

pl.definitions: zbiór wszystkich możliwych ludzkich pojęć minus zbiór pojęć już objętych przez przyjęte słowa tokipońskie, ważony ich względnym wykorzystywaniem
pl.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".

nb.definitions: effective, useful, give good results
nb.commentary: From the time management method developed by Francesco Cirillo in Berlin in the 1980s, for which people often used tomato-shaped timers. In ku, "pomotolo" was given as one of the translations of "tomato", presumably due to speakers misusing or misunderstanding the word.

sv.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has the meaning of "place that is down". In pu, "noka" has that meaning instead.

para baixo

he.sp_etymology: שורש מיקום + "מיכל"; האחרון אולי מריבוע קטום בשביל אובייקט כללי (להשווה sinpin) או מיכל (להשוואה poki). בשביל השורש, ראו גם איך נקודות משומשת בblissymbols (מערכת כתיבה אידאוגרפית); להשוואה blissymbol "below"
he.commentary: בשימוש נפוץ (גם לפני וגם אחרי pu), ל"anpa" יש את המשמעות "מקום שנמצא למטה". בpu, ל"noka" יש את המשמעות הזו במקום.

nb.definitions: (synonymt til a) | ALT sannelig, òg, også
nb.commentary:
In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
Underwent significant changes in usage in 2002, alongside "en" and (now obsolete) "kan".

nb.definitions: (synonymt til sin) | ALT utsmykning, pynt, krydder; ekstra, tillegg
nb.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.

nb.definitions: ord som ikke står i pu-ordboka; nytt ord; tulleord
nb.commentary: Mostly used in conversations in English. Likely was popularised by the :nimisin: emote in ma pona, which was originally used to notify Atawan (maintainer of "nimi ale") about newly coined words. In common speech, the meaning got extended to include most or all non-pu words, regardless if they were coined recently or not.

nl.definitions: een niet-pu woord; een nieuw woord; een woord voor de grap
nl.commentary: Meestal gebruikt in het Engels (of in andere niet-toki pona-talen). Waarschijnlijk populair geworden door de :nimisin: emote in ma pona, die oorspronkelijk gebruikt werd om Atawan (de onderhouden van "nimi ale") te waarschuwen over nieuwe woorden. Bij algemeen gebruik werd de betekenis uitgebreid tot alle niet-pu woorden, onafhankelijk van hoe recent ze zijn.

nb.definitions: øye; å se (på), undersøke, observere, lese; se etter, søke, lete; (pv.) prøve å, forsøke å
nb.sp_etymology: pictogram of an eye. compare blissymbol “eye”
nb.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning.

yi.sp_etymology: pictogram of an eye. compare blissymbol “eye”
yi.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning.

nl.definitions: oog; zien, kijken, onderzoeken, observeren, lezen; zoeken; (als hulpwerkwoord) proberen te
nl.sp_etymology: pictogram van een oog. zie het blissymbool "oog"
nl.commentary: Bij algemeen gebruik (zowel voor als na pu) zijn "lukin" en "oko" afzonderlijke woorden, met elk een eigen betekenis. In pu worden ze beschouwd als synoniemen. Diegenen die het als synoniemen aanzien, gebruiken meestal "oko" nooit en geven de voorkeur aan "lukin" in alle omstandigheden. Het gebruik van "alasa" als zijnde "proberen" komt meer voor het gebruik van "lukin". In pu heeft enkel "lukin" deze betekenis.
